Data: Faulkner to Cook, no run full outside off, Cook comes forward and defends to cover
Faulkner to Cook, no run touch shorter this time, played off the back foot this time to the off side
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run goes fuller, brings Cook into a drive which squirts off a thick outside edge but safely down to third man
Faulkner to Bell, no run full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Faulkner to Bell, no run gets across his stumps and defends towards midwicket
Faulkner to Bell, no run on middle and leg, worked into the on side towards midwicket...steady opening over from Faulkner
Pattinson to Cook, no run good start, full at off stump, 139kph, defended square to point
Pattinson to Cook, 2 runs hint of swing, but it started too straight and it's neatly flicked through midwicket...deep square gets around
Pattinson to Cook, no run left alone outside off, 140kph
Pattinson to Cook, no run on a length outside off, Cook hangs back and defends to cover
Pattinson to Cook, 1 run shorter delivery, on leg stump, pitch appears a touch slow and Cook has plenty of time to ride this into the leg side
Pattinson to Bell, no run nice delivery, back of a length outside off and it comes into Bell, in the air then off the seam, as he shoulders arms
Faulkner to Cook, no run gets forward outside off stump, defended to cover
Faulkner to Cook, FOUR runs superb stroke by Cook, manufactures an on-drive as he fetches this from outside off and drills it firmly straight of mid-on a lot of bottom hand
Faulkner to Cook, no run pulls the length back a little and it's play to cover with another positive stride
Faulkner to Cook, no run excellent delivery, beats Cook with a shorter delivery outside off and the batsman was walking into his shot
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run cuts to backward point who doesn't stop it cleanly so allows a single
Faulkner to Bell, FOUR runs now Bell gets one through the infield, full on middle and off and whipped strongly wide of mid-on over what is a pretty quick outfield
Pattinson to Cook, FOUR runs more intent from Cook, some width offered and drives up and over cover...intentionally in the air
Pattinson to Cook, FOUR runs back-to-back boundaries, driven strongly square of the wicket this time as Pattinson again offers up a fraction of width
Pattinson to Cook, no run a little tighter to off stump, Cook leaves this one alone
Pattinson to Cook, no run short of a length, Cook goes back and defends towards the bowler
Pattinson to Cook, 1 run worked nicely off the pads, short of a length again and placed through midwicket
Pattinson to Bell, no run full outside off, adjusts well to the right hander, defended to point
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run short of a length on off stump, defended square of the wicket
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run defended from the back foot towards cover
Coulter-Nile to Cook, SIX runs dropped in short and Cook responds with a thumping pull shot, in front of square and it clears the deep square-leg boundary...positive signs from the England captain
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run back of a length, 140kph, on off stump and this time it's defence from Cook
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run fuller on middle and off, punched firmly towards mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 2 runs short on leg stump, another nice piece of timing as he flicks it behind square off his pads but Pattinson gets around and slides to cut off the boundary
Pattinson to Bell, no run aggression now from Bell, hammers a length ball towards cover on the up but straight to the fielder
Pattinson to Bell, FOUR runs another boundary, not quite so convincing this time as Bell advances down the pitch then flicks it just out of reach of Coulter-Nile at short fine leg
Pattinson to Bell, FOUR runs big top edge! Runs flowing. Banged in short, Bell went for the pull and it flies straight back over the keep and slips
Pattinson to Bell, no run back of a full length outside off, defended firmly to cover
Pattinson to Bell, no run back of a length, cramping Bell for room a little so he just defends
Pattinson to Bell, no run short of a length, Bell tries to force it through the off side off the back foot but mistimes it back to the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run pushed across outside off, left alone
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run fuller at off stump, Cook onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run flicks this from a full length at middle stump towards mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 1 run gets a cut shot away again but it goes straight to third man
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run extra effort in that delivery, 142kph, and it beats Bell over the top edge as he tries to upper cut it over the slips
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 2 runs and this goes through the vacant slip cordon, although was fairly controlled by Bell as he came down the pitch then opened the face towards third man
Doherty to Cook, no run starts round the wicket to Cook who defends
Doherty to Cook, FOUR runs beautifully played by Cook, he chips down the pitch then flicks this in the air over midwicket and it's placed wide of the sweeper
Doherty to Cook, FOUR runs now he pulls a short ball through the same area, Cook quick to spot the error in length and latched on

Doherty to Cook, no run and what a comeback! Or is it? Given lbw as it beats Cook on the back foot. He's called for a review. Has it pitched outside leg? There's no edge for sure. It's pitched on but missing on height. Cook survives.
Doherty to Cook, no run fuller on off stump, forward and defends
Doherty to Cook, no run now he's beaten by one that skids across outside off stump, he was trying to guide it through short third man
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run dropped at short point by Finch. It was hammered off the back foot by Bell, it was a good height but was certainly going at a rate of knots
Coulter-Nile to Bell, 1 run angled down to third man to bring up England's fifty
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run defended to cover

Coulter-Nile to Cook, OUT gone this time! Just went it appeared things had turned for Cook he drives off the back foot to a short of a length delivery and Maxwell dives to his right at cover to hold a good catch. He was right to attack that delivery, just didn't get over he top of the shot.
Coulter-Nile to Stokes, no run short ball straight over off stump, he sways out of the line
Coulter-Nile to Stokes, no run full on off stump, gets forward and defends to cover
Pattinson to Bell, no run on off stump, defended towards mid-off
Pattinson to Bell, no run tries to work this into space on the off side but picks out cover
Pattinson to Bell, no run short of a length, driven firmly off the back foot to point
Pattinson to Bell, no run gets cramped for room, it was a slightly slower delivery and appeared to grip in the pitch, Bell was early on his shot and it takes an inside edge to the leg side
Pattinson to Bell, 3 runs this time he gets it over the off stump, advances down on the line of leg stump and slices it over point although the timing was quite there
Pattinson to Stokes, no run full outside off, left alone
Doherty to Bell, 1 run on leg stump, flicked just wide of short fine leg and Stokes hustles through for a sharp single
Doherty to Stokes, no run round the wicket, outside off, defended to point
Doherty to Stokes, no run tucked off middle stump to midwicket
Doherty to Stokes, 1 run dragged down a little short, Stokes goes onto the back foot and pulls through midwicket
Doherty to Bell, no run uses his feet but ends up yorking himself and just bunts the ball towards mid-on
Doherty to Bell, no run pushed firmly back to the bowler
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run round the wicket, full at the stumps, worked down the ground to long-on
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run a touch short and pull into midwicket, again not quite timed
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run comes forward, opens the face and placed through point
Maxwell to Bell, FOUR runs Bell does a Maxwell to Maxwell...brings out the reverse sweep, there's a fair bit of top edge involved but it loops well over short third man
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run fuller at middle, driven down to long-on
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run flicked into midwicket
Doherty to Stokes, no run worked from off stump to midwicket
Doherty to Stokes, 1 run stretches forward and places it down to long-on
Doherty to Bell, no run delicate this time from Bell, brings out the reverse paddle but picks out short third man
Doherty to Bell, no run angled in towards middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
Doherty to Bell, no run driven into the off side
Doherty to Bell, 1 run placed nicely off the back foot through the off side, he wanted two quite early on but Stokes sent him back
Maxwell to Bell, no run round the wicket, tickled to short fine leg
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run uses his feet this time and pushed down to long-on
Maxwell to Stokes, no run gets an inside edge into his pads as he plays forward
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run a fraction shorter and played off the back foot down the ground
Maxwell to Bell, 1 run plays the slog sweep, the shot he got out to in Melbourne, has to reach for it a fair bit as it's on off stump but connects well to deep square
Maxwell to Stokes, no run drifts into Stokes, strangled appeal for lbw but wasn't particularly close

Doherty to Bell, 1 run, OUT direct hit! Warner has pulled off a stunning run out. England continue to create their own problems. It was played square through the off side, Bell didn't really hesitate on coming for the second but Warner just swooped too quickly. He had one stump to aim at from side on and was deadly accur
Doherty to Ballance, no run round the wicket, works his first ball from outside off to short fine leg
Doherty to Ballance, no run defended to the off side
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run off the mark with a scampered single to mid-on who is now inside the circle
Doherty to Stokes, no run flicked along the ground to midwicket
Doherty to Stokes, no run played into the off side
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run drifts onto leg stump, tucked out to deep square
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run shorter on leg stump, worked off the pads through the leg side
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run flicked out to deep square-leg
Maxwell to Stokes, no run fuller at off stump, defended into the off side
Maxwell to Stokes, no run traps this off a thick inside edge to the leg side
Maxwell to Stokes, no run nearly gets this under Stokes' bat, fired in very full, he tried to open up the off side and just managed to get a toe end on it
Doherty to Ballance, no run worked to square leg
Doherty to Ballance, no run touch shorter, pushed off the back foot back to the bowler
Doherty to Ballance, no run gets forward this time and worked straight to midwicket
Doherty to Ballance, no run nearly another run out! Tucked to square leg and he was well down the pitch but managed to dive back
Doherty to Ballance, no run driven into the off side, Doherty fields himself
Doherty to Ballance, no run can't get it past Doherty on the on side and that's a maiden
Maxwell to Stokes, no run pushed to the off side
Maxwell to Stokes, no run cut towards short third man
Maxwell to Stokes, no run turn for Maxwell, beats the outside edge as Stokes lunges forward...becoming harder for these two batsmen
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run driven straight down to long-on
Maxwell to Ballance, no run pushed to short cover
Maxwell to Ballance, no run hint of width, he cuts firmly but can't beat point...England coming to a standstill against these two spinners
Doherty to Stokes, no run full on leg stump, goes for a sweep but it just takes the pad
Doherty to Stokes, no run touch shorter, goes onto the back foot but can't beat midwicket
Doherty to Stokes, 1 run gets the sweep away this time, was outside leg stump, runs to deep square leg
Doherty to Ballance, no run reverse sweep this time, doesn't go further than short third man
Doherty to Ballance, no run flicked firmly off middle stump, again finds the man at midwicket
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run fuller and beats midwicket on this occasion as he works it away with a strong bottom
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run plenty of flight from Maxwell and it's driven through cover
Maxwell to Stokes, no run driven back to the bowler on the bounce
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run a little flatter and quicker, Stokes goes back to cut hard and just beats Clarke at point
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run driven through cover for another single
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run delicate from Stokes, soft hands as he dabs this past the keeper and it's cut off in the circle
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run driven down the ground to long-on
Doherty to Ballance, no run punched away to midwicket but good fielding by Maxwell in the circle, cuts off the single
Doherty to Ballance, no run goes the cut but this beats the bat
Doherty to Ballance, no run tossed up from around the wicket and it's fullish, the drive can't beat mid on
Doherty to Ballance, no run driven uppishly and short of mid-off, Ballance just can't find the gaps here
Doherty to Ballance, FOUR runs and now Ballance does find a way to score, he's got to the pitch of this and driven it over mid-off, a good proper shot that bounces away to the boundary
Doherty to Ballance, no run wristy flick from Ballance finds square leg
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run driven down the ground for the easy single to long on
Maxwell to Ballance, 1 run nudged away through the covers and the man in the deep keeps it to one
Maxwell to Stokes, 2 runs Stokes advances and lofts this inside out over and that's bounced away to Warner in the deep

Maxwell to Stokes, no run Maxwell has got through the defences of Stokes with one that goes on with the arm, that looked plumb but Stokes is asking for a review of the lbw! And again the bounce has tricked umpire Martinesz - and this commentator - that was sailing a fraction over the top of the stumps. But Stokes got a b
Maxwell to Stokes, no run defended back towards the bowler
Maxwell to Stokes, 1 run driven away down the ground to long-on for the easy single again
Doherty to Stokes, no run Stokes goes the big sweep to a ball down leg but he misses - and the ball hits him on the pad
Doherty to Stokes, no run again Doherty goes for a leg-side line and Stokes advances, can't get bat on ball and it flies off his pad
Doherty to Stokes, no run Stokes goes back into his crease to defend

Doherty to Stokes, OUT Clarke has taken a stunner at square leg! Holy moly batsman, that is a remarkable catch! Stokes has gone for the sweep and smoked it out of the middle of the bat, Clarke at square leg has had to react instantly and does so, dives to his right and thrusts the right hand low to the ground and the bal
Doherty to Morgan, no run defended back down the pitch
Doherty to Morgan, no run angled across Morgan from around the wicket, and it's driven down to mid-off
Pattinson to Ballance, no run worked away to the leg side by Ballance
Pattinson to Ballance, no run Ballance drops this at his feet and thinks about stealing a single but Morgan sends him back
Pattinson to Ballance, 1 wide Pattinson just gets the line a touch wrong here, slipping it fractionally down leg side for a wide
Pattinson to Ballance, 1 run banged in at the hips and worked away to leg for a single
Pattinson to Morgan, no run angled across Morgan, who leaves it alone
Pattinson to Morgan, no run solid in defence now
Pattinson to Morgan, no run once more Morgan is watchfully leaving outside off
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run clipped away through the leg side for another single
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run Morgan gets off the mark with a nudge down the ground to long-on
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run clipped through midwicket to the man in the deep
Doherty to Morgan, no run again worked away to midwicket, can't beat the fielder in the circle now
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run cut away behind point for another single
Doherty to Ballance, no run once again the man at short midwicket prevents a run
Pattinson to Morgan, 1 run short of a length from Pattinson and Morgan nudges a single to leg
Pattinson to Ballance, FOUR runs well played by Ballance, gets the width he's been denied for a while and crunches a cut hard over the top of point for a pretty safe boundary
Pattinson to Ballance, 1 wide down leg now from Pattinson, just getting his line wrong here
Pattinson to Ballance, 1 run fuller and angled across Ballance, who drives uppishly off a thickish edge through cover point
Pattinson to Morgan, 1 run Morgan cuts forward of point for another single
Pattinson to Ballance, 2 runs lovely cover-drive here from Ballance as he comes forward and times it nicely through the gap in the infield but there is a sweeper who cuts off the boundary
Pattinson to Ballance, (no ball) 1 run Pattinson goes the slower ball now - and oversteps - and Ballance guides it off the face to third man
Pattinson to Morgan, FOUR runs Morgan gets the free hit and Pattinson's short ball on leg is pulled away for a boundary to fine leg
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run nudged away for a single
Doherty to Morgan, no run leans forward to punch it back to Doherty
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run Morgan backs off a touch now and punches wide of mid-off
Doherty to Ballance, 1 run drifting in from around the wicket and it's pushed away to long on
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run on middle and leg again and worked through midwicket
Doherty to Ballance, no run again worked straight to the man in the circle at midwicket
Christian to Morgan, 1 run slowish outside off and Morgan waits on a late cut towards third man
Christian to Ballance, no run 104kph from Christian - almost a Chris Harris-style effort this - and it's pushed away to off
Christian to Ballance, 1 run he's taking all the pace off the ball here - 109kph - and it's pushed through leg
Christian to Morgan, no run angled in from around the wicket and it's driven to mid-on
Christian to Morgan, no run slow again, and again the batsman can't quite force the pace to get it through the field
Christian to Morgan, 1 run wide of off and steered away to third man off the face of the bat
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run driven down towards mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run pushed away through the gap at cover for a single

Coulter-Nile to Ballance, OUT Coulter-Nile makes the breakthrough, and it's a rather poor piece of placement from Ballance. He's got some width and went the cut shot but sliced it upwards and Christian was out at deep point and ran in to take a reasonably comfortable catch
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run Morgan drops it at the feet but doesn't want a single
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run left alone outside off
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run driven towards cover and can't find the gap
Christian to Bopara, no run Christian is over the wicket now to Bopara and continues to take the pace off the ball, it's defended
Christian to Bopara, no run swinging in towards off stump and Bopara defends
Christian to Bopara, no run 107kph and Bopara nudges it to leg, he's trying to get used to the pace here
Christian to Bopara, 2 runs Christian goes for the leg-stump yorker now and overpitches just a touch, Bopara clips behind square leg and runs hard for two

Christian to Bopara, no run driven away through cover - and I mean through - as a diving Clarke seemed to have that covered and then got a horrid bounce that sees the ball bounce over him - and mid-off backs up
Christian to Bopara, 1 run worked away for another single
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run good running from Bopara as he calls a quick single with his nudge just forward of point
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run another quick single as Morgan steers it down into the turf and Haddin gets around to collect it
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run accurate from Coulter-Nile on off stump, Bopara defends
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run left alone outside off
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run Bopara opens the face and steers this past the sole slip away to third man
Christian to Bopara, no run goes well wide of off now and Bopara can't beat point
Christian to Bopara, 1 run 116kph now and Bopara steers a single through the vacant cordon
Christian to Morgan, no run Morgan defends solidly to the off side, seems cautious about going after Christian at this slow pace
Christian to Morgan, no run Morgan goes back into his crease and bunts to leg, can't justify a single
Christian to Morgan, FOUR runs bad ball - that's what Christian can't afford to do - he drops it short and Morgan has no trouble at all pulling this in the air behind square leg for a boundary
Christian to Morgan, 1 run wide of off now and Morgan punches a single to deep point
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run around the wicket and accurate from Maxwell - Morgan goes back and cuts
Maxwell to Bopara, no run still around the wicket to Bopara, who advances and just nudges to leg
Maxwell to Bopara, no run pushed away to the leg side again and can't find the gap
Maxwell to Bopara, no run down leg side and tickled off the pad for a single - ah, but the umpire has called a dead ball, deciding Bopara hadn't played a shot
Maxwell to Bopara, 1 run flicked through square leg for one run
Maxwell to Morgan, no run almost round-arm from Maxwell now as he skids this flat one on and Morgan defends
Christian to Bopara, 1 run Bopara waits on this ball from Christian and forces a quick single to mid-off, where Pattinson fumbles
Christian to Morgan, 1 run cuts hard into the ground and Morgan picks up one more, the runs trickling slowly here
Christian to Bopara, 1 run a touch short from Christian outside off and Bopara's pull through midwicket is collected in the deep

Christian to Morgan, FOUR runs again Morgan latches on to a short ball from Christian, he's pulled it hard and just forward of deep midwicket, who for a moment seemed he may have a catching chance, but this bounces away for a boundary
Christian to Morgan, no run fuller now and driven back to Christian
Christian to Morgan, no run steered away towards backward point
Maxwell to Bopara, 1 run Maxwell is around the wicket to Bopara, who tickles one to short fine leg
Maxwell to Morgan, no run driven away to extra cover and can't pierce the gap
Maxwell to Morgan, no run Morgan leans out of his crease to defend
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run Morgan rocks back to late cut but there's a deep backward point who cuts this off
Maxwell to Bopara, no run skids across the right-hander and beats the bat - it was an attempted glance to third man
Maxwell to Bopara, no run Bopara again can't get bat on ball, tries to force a cut to a skiddy ball
Faulkner to Morgan, no run defended back towards Faulkner

Faulkner to Morgan, SIX runs Morgan has decided with the field up it's time to go, and go he does! Advances to Faulkner and lifts this over extra cover with such timing that it's sailed into the stands for six!
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run now he picks up a single down to long-on
Faulkner to Bopara, no run Bopara nudges this away to leg
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run now he gets a single through square leg to give Morgan another chance in this over
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run Morgan just drops this into the off side and takes off for a well-judged single
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, no run clubbed into midwicket but can't beat the man inside the ring
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, FOUR runs finds the gap this time, full and angling into the pads again, he swings hard and gets it wide of the diving midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, 1 run goes to the on side again, it was fuller and not as well timed so midwicket cuts it off
Coulter-Nile to Jordan, no run back of a length, Jordan can't do anything else than jab to the off side
Coulter-Nile to Jordan, 1 run full and straight, gets this one into space on the leg side
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, 1 run he hooks, well controlled as he managed to roll his wrists but long leg keeps them to a single
Christian to Bresnan, no run full at off stump, driven firmly into the pitch and Christian fields it one-handed to his right
Christian to Bresnan, 1 run driven down to long-on
Christian to Jordan, 1 run full and straight, flicked to short fine-leg
Christian to Bresnan, 1 run keeping it full, on leg stump this time, no width for Bresnan who drives to long-on
Christian to Jordan, 1 run outside off, he drives and it comes off a thick outside to short third man
Christian to Bresnan, 1 run low full toss but it doesn't go further than deep midwicket. A good over from Christian
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run Morgan drives through point and one of the men in the deep is out there to cut the ball off
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run worked away comfortably through square leg for another one
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run Morgan gets forward to cover drive again but only a single
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run good accurate bouncer mixes things up - haven't seen too many of them in this match - and Bopara just sways out of the way
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run again this is on the rise as it gets through to Haddin, some good extra bounce sails past Bopara at chest height
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run tickled away to fine leg for a single
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run on leg stump, worked into the square-leg area
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run pushed square into the off side with an open face
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run fuller at off stump, Bopara on-drives and beats Faulkner who dives in his follow through
Faulkner to Morgan, no run gives himself room to leg, Faulkner drags down a slower ball and Morgan only connects with fresh air
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run fuller on middle and leg, pushed firmly down to long-on
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run dropped behind square on the off side with soft hands...careful stuff from England
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run full at middle, jabbed into the leg side
Faulkner to Jordan, no run goes for the surprise bouncer and it beats Jordan's pull
Faulkner to Jordan, FOUR runs that's a clean blow! Short again, but not quite so short, and this time Jordan connects out of the middle and pulls in front of square

Faulkner to Jordan, OUT this time he picks out the fielder...another good catch. Jordan trying to go over the leg side again, gets height but not the distance - needed to fetch it from outside off - and Finch steadied himself at deep square-leg
Faulkner to Bresnan, 2 runs placed backward of point wide of third man so Bresnan can keep the strike
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run yorker outside off, he can't get it further than back to the bowler
Christian to Tredwell, 1 run round the wicket, full on middle, worked down to long-on
Christian to Bresnan, SIX runs that's into the second tier over deep midwicket! Christian just got the length slightly, on a length, allowing him to get underneath and launch it clear into the stands

Christian to Bresnan, SIX runs and again! Late boost for England. This time it was shorter and he pulled it, not quite so well time as the previous one but enough brute force to just clear Maxwell at deep midwicket
Christian to Bresnan, 1 run gets the yorker in, driven down the ground
Christian to Tredwell, 1 run opens the face to backward point to give Bresnan the last ball
Christian to Bresnan, 1 run inches from another boundary...Bresnan lapped a low full toss from outside off, but Coulter-Nile pulled off a terrific dive at short fine leg so it's just a single

England finish with 243. You feel that's about 25 short, but those late blows from Tim Bresnan has just given them a little of hope. The pitch is slow and gripping, especially once the new ball(s) wear off. The stand-out feature, though, was Australia's fielding. Some magnificent stuff on show. We can expect Warner and Finch to

Welcome back for the chase, Australia's openers have made their way out on to the SCG and the hosts need 244 to take this series without worrying about the remaining two games. There were some very useful late runs from Tim Bresnan in England's innings - will that be the difference? It's Chris Jordan with the first of the new b
Jordan to Finch, no run can't get bat on the first one, this lobs off the body in front of Finch after he tried to turn it to leg

Jordan to Finch, 1 run oh dear, what is going on out there? Warner has nearly been run out without facing a ball. Finch has punched it to cover and called a single, Warner basically gave up on the run about three-quarters down the pitch but the throw missed
Jordan to Warner, no run full and straight, Warner can't beat mid-on
Jordan to Warner, 1 wide swings down leg side and that is called a wide
Jordan to Warner, no run some width now and Warner slashes outside off but it beats the bat
Jordan to Warner, no run some inswing now from Jordan, strikes Warner on the leg as he can't get it away
Jordan to Warner, 1 run on the back foot Warner punches to extra cover and takes off for a well judged single
Broad to Warner, 1 run quick single immediately as Warner pushes to mid off and takes off
Broad to Finch, no run defended back down the pitch to the bowler
Broad to Finch, FOUR runs strays on to the pads now and Finch clips this behind square leg for the first boundary of the innings
Broad to Finch, 1 leg bye takes off for a quick leg bye on to the leg side

Broad to Warner, FOUR runs super placement from Warner as he gets some width and rocks on to the back foot to crunch this through extra cover, piercing the field and sending it along the ground to the boundary
Broad to Warner, no run defended away to the off side now
Jordan to Finch, 2 runs on the pads and Finch has no trouble clipping this away behind square for a couple
Jordan to Finch, 2 runs on the back foot Finch flicks it again through the leg side as Jordan gets a touch too straight
Jordan to Finch, no run this time Finch plays straighter and can't find the gap
Jordan to Finch, 1 run wide of off at 144kph and Finch punches behind point for a single
Jordan to Warner, no run inswing to Warner's leg-stump line and it's defended
Jordan to Warner, 1 run too much down leg from Jordan, who just can't quite find his line, and Warner easily works it through square leg
Broad to Warner, 1 run another very quick single as Warner pushes to off and runs immediately, good judgment
Broad to Finch, 1 wide down leg side and Finch can't get anything on it, so that's a wide
Broad to Finch, no run better line now just outside off and Finch defends
Broad to Finch, 1 run on the pads again and those are easy runs - clipped through square leg
Broad to Warner, 1 run Warner nudges this off the hips to leg for another comfortable single
Broad to Finch, no run better from Broad, a touch of away swing and outside off, that's where you may just get Finch early in his innings - he pushes it to point
Broad to Finch, 1 run and back to the pads - Finch clips it through square again
Jordan to Finch, 1 run better line outside off from Jordan and Finch pushes it away through point
Jordan to Warner, no run fullish and on off stump, Warner drives down towards mid-off
Jordan to Warner, no run Jordan at 146kph here, tempts Warner outside off but it's not as short as Warner thought - his cut misses
Jordan to Warner, 1 run shorter now and on the leg stump, Warner pulls it around the corner down to fine leg
Jordan to Finch, no run Finch is solid in defence now on off stump

Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs thumpingly strong straight drive from Aaron Finch now, he's got a fullish straight ball and punched it back from whence it came - so straight it's very nearly hit the non-striker's stumps.
Broad to Warner, no run Broad at 137kph now and tempting Warner into the drive, which finds mid-off
Broad to Warner, no run cuts it down into the ground and can't beat point
Broad to Warner, no run crunches a cut away that isn't quite timed
Broad to Warner, FOUR runs muscular pull now from Warner, really well timed through midwicket as Broad just gives him a short ball that is of no real threat - chest height.
Broad to Warner, no run gets back into his crease to defend now
Broad to Warner, 2 runs clipped off the pads now as the line is wrong again
Jordan to Finch, 1 wide England just can't get their bowling right - this is yet another one skewed down leg for a wide

Jordan to Finch, no run there's an lbw shout here and Jordan is pretty interested but the umpire isn't - Finch drove hard at a straight ball. England decide against a review and it's a good call - there was an inside edge there.
Jordan to Finch, 1 run straight ball, straight punch that is collected by mid-on
Jordan to Warner, no run Warner waits on this one and steers it to point
Jordan to Warner, 1 run clipped off the pads and away to fine leg
Jordan to Finch, FOUR runs Finch gets on the back foot now and crunches it through point, fine timing and placement

Jordan to Finch, OUT Jordan has struck! The runs were flowing but Finch couldn't stop himself driving hard in the air and there is a man at cover who has no trouble holding this catch. He'll be disappointed with himself there - just couldn't keep that along the ground
Bresnan to Warner, no run on the back foot now, Warner defends
Bresnan to Warner, SIX runs what a shot! Warner has picked a length ball and just hit right through it, driving hard and down the ground over long-off, with enough timing to clear the boundary
Bresnan to Warner, no run outside off and through to the keeper
Bresnan to Warner, no run Warner falls over now as he nudges this to leg and gets in a bit of a tangle
Bresnan to Warner, no run probes outside off and Warner defends with a straight bat

Bresnan to Warner, 1 run oh, Warner has nearly joined Finch back in the rooms! He's gone for the pull from a shortish ball but didn't get hold of it, the top edge flies out and lobs just over the head of the midwicket - that wasn't far away at all
Jordan to Warner, no run cuts hard and it's collected at point
Jordan to Warner, 2 runs Warner waits on this and cuts away towards third man
Jordan to Warner, no run punched away off the pads to midwicket
Jordan to Warner, no run cuts hard and finds the man in the infield
Jordan to Warner, no run Warner gets back into his crease and defends from outside off
Jordan to Warner, 2 runs fuller and straighter and Warner clips it through mid-on, who fumbles - Tim Bresnan it was - and lets a one become a two
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh finally gets to face a ball after two overs at the non-striker's end - he gets off the mark with a nudge to leg

Bresnan to Warner, FOUR runs short ball from Bresnan and Warner has nailed this pull, he was very quickly on to that and pulled it up into the air, wide of the man at deep midwicket and it's one bounce over the boundary
Bresnan to Warner, no run shortish outside off now and Warner tries to dab at that, misses the ball though
Bresnan to Warner, FOUR runs really good placement once again - Warner has cut this hard off the back foot and found the gap between point and cover
Bresnan to Warner, no run fuller and outside off, Warner pushes to point
Bresnan to Warner, FOUR runs another boundary now as Warner gets on on the hips and glances it wide of fine leg, who is in the circle, which in turn means that is always going to run away for four
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run Marsh nudges a quick single to the off side
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run Tredwell sneaks in with his quick action and Warner punches a single down to mid-off
Tredwell to Marsh, no run Marsh leans out to defend
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run tossed up a fraction more, and wide of off, Marsh drives through cover
Tredwell to Warner, no run on the stumps and a touch slower, no real spin though and Warner defends
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run Warner punches a single out to deep cover
Bresnan to Warner, no run lovely delivery from Bresnan as this one pitches on leg and nips away off the seam - moves too far, in fact, as that has beaten Warner's outside edge by quite a way
Bresnan to Warner, 1 run steered away through point
Bresnan to Marsh, no run on the back foot and Marsh defends
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh waits on this one and cuts very late, just a single though to third man
Bresnan to Warner, 2 runs worked off the pads through square leg and that's very good running as they turn this into two
Bresnan to Warner, 1 leg bye tickled away off the leg behind square
Tredwell to Warner, no run tossed up from around the wicket, it's defended from middle stump
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run turned away through square for a single
Tredwell to Marsh, no run tossed up outside off at 84kph and it's defended
Tredwell to Marsh, no run this one does for Marsh and nearly tickles his edge! It has turned just a fraction, and just enough to trick Marsh, who thought it was the straight one
Tredwell to Marsh, no run defended away to the off side
Tredwell to Marsh, no run Marsh again defends carefully
Bresnan to Warner, no run Warner drives hard down the ground but this is cut off by mid-off - that ball was flying!
Bresnan to Warner, 1 run slower ball at 117kph and Warner picks it well enough to just nudge to the off side and hare off for a quick single
Bresnan to Marsh, no run good line on middle and off, Marsh square up a little and pushes it to point
Bresnan to Marsh, FOUR runs a little too short from Bresnan and Marsh swivels a pull through square leg and through the gap

Bresnan to Marsh, no run full and wide of off, Marsh drives hard and thinks it's through but Tredwell at mid-off has done super well to dive and cut that off one-handed - that was a boundary otherwise
Bresnan to Marsh, no run play and miss outside off
Tredwell to Warner, no run a tiny bit of turn, but not much - it's pushed away to the off side
Tredwell to Warner, no run Warner uses the feet now and drives but straight to cover
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run Warner drives down the ground for the easy single available to long-off
Tredwell to Marsh, no run Marsh tries to whip this through leg but can't beat mid-on
Tredwell to Marsh, FOUR runs good use of the feet from Marsh and he clips this straight enough on the leg side that it beats mid-on - fine placement as that runs away to the boundary
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run worked away through leg for a single now
Bopara to Marsh, no run fullish on the stumps and driven away through cover
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run some width for Marsh, who late cuts this along the ground to third man
Bopara to Warner, 1 run tries for the yorker length ball on leg but it's clipped away for a single
Bopara to Marsh, no run skiddy on off stump and Marsh pushes to off
Bopara to Marsh, no run Bopara pitches on leg and Marsh closes the face to work it away into the on side but the bowler does some sharp fielding off his own bowling

Bopara to Marsh, no run is this a catch? No! Oh boy, that was close. Angled across Marsh, who drove hard outside off and it flew low towards backward point, where Morgan dived forward and took the ball pretty cleanly, but it must have been on the half-volley as he wasn't interested in asking the question about a catch. T
Tredwell to Warner, no run defended from the off-stump line, no real turn there

Tredwell to Warner, 1 run there's the half-century for Warner, from his 56th delivery, and he does it with an easy enough single, just a punch through cover point off a ball that was a touch too short
Tredwell to Marsh, 2 runs uses the feet now and clips this through square leg, good sharp running turns this into a two
Tredwell to Marsh, no run leans forward to defend
Tredwell to Marsh, no run this one just goes on with the arm into the left-hander, he pushes it to leg
Tredwell to Marsh, no run defended away to the off side now
Bopara to Warner, 1 run back of a length on off stump, dropped into the off side and another scampered single...he's so hard to stop
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run full and wide, driven very hard through square cover to the sweeper
Bopara to Warner, no run straighter, driven to mid-off
Bopara to Warner, 1 wide slips down the leg side so that's an extra run and delivery
Bopara to Warner, 1 run driven through point
Bopara to Marsh, 1 leg bye an appeal for lbw from Bopara, but no else...it pitched outside leg
Bopara to Warner, 2 runs poor line, worked off leg stump backward of square on the leg side...almost runs away from the fielder
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run uses his feet then works through midwicket
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run tossed up a little more, makes it into a low full toss as he comes down the pitch and it's another run through midwicket
Tredwell to Marsh, 2 runs down the pitch again, driven through a tightly packed off-side field
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run nice touch play this time, opens the face and places it between point and cover
Tredwell to Warner, SIX runs all the way...Warner couldn't resist any longer, he goes down on one knee and slog-sweeps over deep midwicket
Tredwell to Warner, 1 run touch quicker and flatter, no surprise there, and tucked into midwicket
Broad to Warner, FOUR runs he's on a roll, doesn't allow Broad to settle in, it's a length delivery on the stumps and Warner lofts it over mid-off. Wasn't out of the middle. Didn't matter.
Broad to Warner, no run more energy on this delivery, 137kph, and beats Warner as he goes for a cut
Broad to Warner, no run defended firmly back to Broad who they hurls the ball back pas the stumps to Buttler
Broad to Warner, no run back of a length, tries to turn this to the leg side and it comes off a leading edge to cover
Broad to Warner, 1 run pushed firmly towards mid-off and another of those singles that have characterised this innings as much as the boundaries
Broad to Marsh, no run round the wicket, on off stump, defended
Stokes to Warner, FOUR runs and he's greeted like Broad was, width outside off, full, and driven through cover with disdain
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run on off stump, tries to get forward and the ball takes the inside edge through square leg
Stokes to Marsh, no run full at leg stump, takes the pad to the leg side
Stokes to Marsh, no run onto the front foot, pushed square to point
Stokes to Marsh, no run back of a length, tries to drop and run into the off side but cover is quickly in
Broad to Clarke, 2 runs back of a length outside off, opens the face on the back foot and places it wide of third man
Broad to Clarke, no run full at off stump, driven sweetly straight and Broad gets a hand on it in his followthrough
Broad to Clarke, no run keeps it full, driven to cover
Broad to Clarke, 1 run shorter delivery, Clarke works it off his pads behind square
Broad to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, outside off, opens the face and runs it wide of slip to third man
Broad to Clarke, 3 runs low full toss and he drives it between cover and mid-off, but it came from low the bat so didn't quite reach the boundary
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs that's a cracking shot from Clarke, leans into a full delivery and drills it straight the ground
Stokes to Clarke, no run not quite so full this time, onto the front foot and driven again but this time Stokes can stop it
Stokes to Clarke, 1 run back of a length at off stump, goes for the pull but wasn't quite short enough and it comes off a bottom/inside edge to fine leg
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run worked off the stumps into midwicket
Stokes to Clarke, no run outside off, left alone
Stokes to Clarke, FOUR runs well, this short ball had him in some trouble, skidded onto Clarke has went to pull and it was an unconvincing shot that whistled down to fine leg
Broad to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, neatly taken from around off stump out to deep square
Broad to Clarke, 3 runs full and wide, driven through the covers...Bopara chases it down near the rope
Broad to Marsh, 1 run chopped down to third man...rotating between the left and right hander
Broad to Clarke, 1 wide there's the short ball but it's shoved down the leg side
Broad to Clarke, no run full outside off, driven back down the pitch
Broad to Clarke, 2 runs dropped in short, but not really with aggression, sits up comfortable and Clarke pulls through midwicket
Broad to Clarke, no run outside off, Clarke leaves it alone
Tredwell to Marsh, no run comes down the pitch straight away then flicks to midwicket
Tredwell to Marsh, no run beats him this time as Marsh opens the face to try and guide down to third man...some turn and bounce
Tredwell to Marsh, no run played square into the off side
Tredwell to Marsh, no run gets the back-cut away this time but finds short third time
Tredwell to Marsh, no run punched off the back foot back to Tredwell
Tredwell to Marsh, 2 runs it's an edge, but a controlled one as it guides this very fine past Buttler
Jordan to Clarke, no run full outside off, driven on the up to cover
Jordan to Clarke, no run tight on off stump, defended and it runs to point
Jordan to Clarke, 1 run pushed into midwicket from a full length
Jordan to Marsh, no run short of a length going across Marsh, he chops into the off side
Jordan to Marsh, no run that's a crunching off drive, tempting length from Jordan, but he picked out mid-off
Jordan to Marsh, FOUR runs he drives again, this time up and over mid-on...it wasn't a bad delivery, back of a length. A hint of Warner in that.
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run round the wicket, Clarke uses his feet and places it through straight midwicket...Marsh slips to prevent any chance of a second
Tredwell to Marsh, no run nicely bowled, flighted on middle and there's a hint of turn as Marsh plays to cover
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run driven down to long-off
Tredwell to Clarke, no run dragged down short but get gets away with it as Clarke pulls to square leg
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run down the pitch again, it's so natural for Clarke, and pushed down to long-on
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run now Marsh uses his feet as well, not quite so light as Clarke but just as effective as he then works down the ground

Jordan to Marsh, 2 runs close! Just wide of cover. Marsh drives on the up and it goes wide of a diving Bell as he leaps to his left. Bottom hand came off the bat. Maybe a slower delivery which stopped in the pitch
Jordan to Marsh, 1 run flicked away from off stump through square leg
Jordan to Clarke, no run driven firmly back at Jordan, Clarke going very hard at the ball in this innings. Wants the job done.
Jordan to Clarke, no run back of a length, on off stump, defended

Jordan to Clarke, FOUR runs tough chance! Driven on the up by Clarke, back at Jordan to his left and he doesn't time its grab probably and the ball is past him. Didn't come back as hard as the Warner catch in Brisbane
Jordan to Clarke, FOUR runs lovely stroke, flicked sweetly through square leg just to make Jordan feel even better
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run driven out to the cover sweeper
Bopara to Clarke, no run back of a length outside off, hint of shape back into Clarke who defends
Bopara to Clarke, 2 runs big full toss, Clarke doesn't time his whip to the leg side but still gets a couple to deep square
Bopara to Haddin, 1 run driven on the up into the off side
Bopara to Marsh, no run he's really getting it to move (he often does) and this one beats Marsh who was prodding at it without much footwork
Jordan to Haddin, 2 runs full at off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on who dives but then parries the ball away from him to allow a second
Jordan to Haddin, 1 run defended off the back foot towards mid-on, it's Bresnan there and he's on his heels a bit
Jordan to Marsh, 1 run full on middle and off, whipped very firmly towards mid-on where Broad can't stop it cleanly
Jordan to Haddin, no run defended to point
Jordan to Haddin, no run big shout for lbw, he's a long way across his stumps but height will be the issue and Cook declines a review
Jordan to Haddin, no run full outside off, Haddin hanging back a touch in the crease as he defends to cover
Bopara to Marsh, no run continues to cause some problems, this time Marsh gets a think bottom edge on a cut which bobbles back quite close to the stumps
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run this one is a touch fuller and he works it down to long-on
Bopara to Haddin, no run back of a length outside off, punched to cover
Bopara to Haddin, no run tries something expansive, it's a full delivery and he gives himself a touch of room then drills to mid-off
Bopara to Haddin, no run defended on the back foot to midwicket
Bopara to Haddin, no run shaping in from outside off, driven to mid-off
Stokes to Marsh, FOUR runs starts with a full toss which is dispatched through midwicket with a strong bottom-handed flick
Stokes to Marsh, 2 runs attempted yorker, he's not far off but Marsh is able to squeeze it out to deep square leg
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run tucked wide of mid-on
Stokes to Haddin, 1 leg bye short of a length, loops off the thigh pad and it's a sharpish single as Buttler races in to field
Stokes to Marsh, no run early on a drive and it loops into the off side but short of cover
Stokes to Marsh, 1 run short of a length on the hip, gets inside the line and tucks down to fine leg
Tredwell to Marsh, no run round the wicket, defended to backward point
Tredwell to Marsh, no run edged! Did it carry to Cook at slip? Was very low, hit him full on the ankle so technically a chance
Tredwell to Marsh, no run defended to the leg side
Tredwell to Marsh, no run down the pitch, aiming to the leg side but it goes straight back to Tredwell
Tredwell to Marsh, FOUR runs just a hint of width and he powers away a cut shot backward of point...takes him to his second fifty. Taking his chance at No. 3
Tredwell to Marsh, 3 runs short on leg stump, nicely whipped behind square and it nearly reaches the rope well but there's a sprawling save
Bopara to Marsh, 1 run driven out to deep cover
Bopara to Haddin, no run on off stump, pushed into the off side and midwicket does well to cut off a single
Bopara to Haddin, no run defended to cover
Bopara to Haddin, no run driven to mid-on
Bopara to Haddin, 2 byes beats everyone, nipping back again and scoots past the inside edge then Buttler fails to glove it
Bopara to Haddin, no run straight drive which is so straight it crashes into the non-striker's stumps
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run driven down to long-on
Tredwell to Haddin, no run defended on the back foot
Tredwell to Haddin, 1 run fuller this time, he leans forward and turns it into midwicket
Tredwell to Marsh, no run picks out midwicket
Tredwell to Marsh, no run full on off stump, defended
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run touch quicker, runs off an open face wide of slip to short third man
Broad to Marsh, 1 run Marsh flicks off the pads and picks up a single
Broad to Haddin, no run Haddin goes back in his crease to defend

Broad to Haddin, SIX runs well now, Haddin is not waiting! He wants this over as quickly as possible, he just backs off a touch and slogs this over cow corner, with such timing that it's cleared the boundary for six

Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs the runs are flowing as Haddin backs off again but this time opens the face to quite deliberately slice this over the men at backward point and short third man - nobody back there in the deep
Broad to Haddin, 1 run tries for the big leg-side swipe again but checks his shot and just runs it down along the ground to long-on
Broad to Marsh, no run Marsh crunches a cover-drive into the ground to the man in the ring
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run starts with a good ball, a touch of inswing and that's almost yorker length, Haddin is good enough though to drive a single down to long-off
Bresnan to Marsh, no run Bresnan comes around the wicket to Marsh and gets the yorker length right again, Marsh can't get it away
Bresnan to Marsh, no run tries the yorker again, just a touch short, and Marsh drives to cover
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh watches a late cut onto the bat from off middle stump
Bresnan to Haddin, no run Bresnan bangs this in short, not called a wide but that must have been tight, was pretty high
Bresnan to Haddin, FOUR runs more runs for Haddin, this could end very quickly if he can get much of the strike, he's latched on to a wide one and driven it in the air through cover for four more
Broad to Marsh, no run another late cut from Marsh but this one can't beat short third man
Broad to Marsh, 1 run good placement as Marsh drives through point to the man in the deep
Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin again opens up and slogs this over cow corner! That's a slog, that's all there is to it, but a well struck one

Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs very clever stuff from Haddin now as he uses his feet, deceives the bowler and gets back in his crease to steer this off the face between point and short third man, all the way along the ground for a boundary
Broad to Haddin, no run driven down to mid-off and this one doesn't beat the field
Broad to Haddin, no run Haddin backs off and crunches this down into the turf
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run touch too full as Bresnan tries for the yorker, Marsh clips it through midwicket
Bresnan to Haddin, no run full and wide of off, Haddin's drive finds cover

Bresnan to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin continues to pepper cow corner, on one knee this time for what could almost be described as a slog sweep, he hasn't quite got enough of it to clear the boundary but it bounces just a couple of metres short
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run through midwicket along the ground now for a single, tame by Haddin's standards at the moment
Bresnan to Marsh, no run angled in to the pads of Marsh, and that's what it hits
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh picks up one more with a drive in the air down towards long on
Jordan to Marsh, no run Marsh drives this away but can't beat point
Jordan to Marsh, no run Marsh gets a full one on the legs and flicks it away to short fine leg - can't beat the fielder though
Jordan to Marsh, FOUR runs this one does get fine enough though, Jordan strays on to the pads again and Marsh glances this away for four
Jordan to Marsh, 1 run Marsh drives down to long-off for a single
Jordan to Haddin, 1 run full again and Haddin drives a single to long-on, Australia are one clean hit away from a series win now
Jordan to Marsh, FOUR runs and there it is! Marsh clips over midwicket for a boundary and that is the match and the series! Australia have an unbeatable 3-0 lead

So there you have it, Clarke has foreshadowed that Warner may well set out of the next couple of matches. Clarke also says he is likely to sit out of the Perth match now that the series has been won. That would mean George Bailey would captain the side, if he is fit again. Join us for that match on Friday. Until then, from Bryd
England's batting caused them problems - they just couldn't get on top of Australia's bowlers at any stage. Xavier Doherty was especially miserly, but so were most of the bowlers.

So there you have it, Australia have won this match with ten overs to spare and seven wickets in hand, a comprehensive victory to give them the series with two matches still to play. It's the first time for a long time that a team has followed an Ashes triumph with a victory in the one-day series straight afterwards - England's
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 60 balls remaining)
Player of the match is David Warner, AUS
